body: I did add some additional get commands, I will send you the list separately.

Were testcases added to regressions to test this feature?
Would this work for hbase "_ROW_", "_CELL_", "_MAP_" formats? They all have HBASE as catalog name.
Would 'drop hbase table' command remove added comments? 
Would unregister command remove comments? It will remove the added objectuid for that hbase table.
It will also be better to use 'if not registered' instead of 'if not exists' construct. They both are supported.
Thanks, I wanted this feature for many years, now you made it happen :-)
@robertamarton All your comments have been incorporated, could I merge this PR? üòÅ
@robertamarton Thanks Roberta, I'll merge this PR :sun_with_face:

@traflm  Sorry for the delay.  I believe, when you make a coprocessor call it can raise two exceptions
ServiceException and Throwable.   My understanding is the ServiceException is retryable, while Throwable exception is the wrapper for the exception raised in the coprocessor code, which may or may not be retryable.  The coprocessor code can also return an exception in the response as a text. See TransactionManager.java for details. 

I haven't tested this understanding fully. 

Are you assuming that ret would be null in case of ServiceException? In that case, the ServiceException would be caught and would never be retried.
I am not an expert in maven. So, my review is of little use here.

Was any performance tests run that compares previous C++ interface with new java interface?
Are all existing lob functionalities available with the new interface? How were they tested?

Hi, Selva, I didn't get very clear understanding of the exceptions here. You mentioned there are two kinds of exceptions, and ServiceException is retryable; while Throwable is not retryable.
So I can catch these two exceptions and assign the retry flag. But your last statement is unclear to me: 'the ServiceException would be caught and would never be retired"
I assume if there is RPC error (retryable), the ret will be null, but it is very hard to simulate, and I cannot find descriptions in HBase manuals about this. 
I never saw throwable exception description in https://hbase.apache.org/devapidocs/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/MasterRpcServices.html , so not sure how to handle that exception. I assume we just return error to caller for throwable exception.
Let me make this change.

Yes.  All the lob functionalities are available with the new hdfs access APIs.  executor/TEST130 is used to test the lob functionality.  No, Performance tests weren't done. But I have reduced the number of APIs needed to do a particular functionality. It is expected to improve because it is just the replacement of libhdfs API with the new reduced number of APIs. The rest of the lob layer remains the same.
BTW, I am still working on couple of failures with executor/TEST130.
General comment, the toggle should be a CQD and not an envvar.   We will need the ability to switch back easier than setting an envvar just like we did for  hdfs scan.
Also the JDBC test suite exercises the LOB interface in a different way than the executor/TEST130 does so we need to make sure those pass as well.
I had similar thinking of using CQD, but I need to find a easy way to pass the CQD to the expression.
Which Jdbc test suite should I run? Is the jdbc-tests test-suite in check PR good enough?

For CQD, it shoudl be similar to how we pass in the LOB_MAX_MEM_CHUNK_LEN or LOB_MAX_SIZE.   For the tests, "swjdbc"  is a script in the scripts directory  that will launch all the tests. There are 4  specific tests within that  TestBlob, TestCob and TestBlobBatch and TestClobBatch which are specific to lobs.

Some of the comments in TRAFODION-3084 apply here as well. 

Were testcases added to regressions to test this feature?
Would 'drop table hive.hive.t' or 'cleanup table hive.hive.t' command remove added comments?
Would unregister command remove comments? It will remove the added objectuid for that hbase table.
It will also be better to use 'if not registered' instead of 'if not exists' construct in the register command.
They both are supported.

Another question: it will be better that comments are added to NATable structure when it is
constructed. Right now looks like comments are read from metadata whenever a showddl command is
issued. That is an expensive operation and will be repeated for each call.
Comments should be read when NATable is constructed and then attached to it. This is how all
other table related structures/data are populated and kept. Those comments can then be retrieved
from NATable instead of reading from metadata.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/2762/

@svarnau I updated my first comment about 2 weeks ago to answer @zellerh 's question. But maybe I updated it in the wrong place so that you did not notice that. So I paste my explanations below.

For query " insert into to t1 select seqnum(seq1, next) from t1;", there is no SORT as left child of TSJ, and it is a self-referencing updates Halloween problem. In NestedJoin::genWriteOpLeftChildSortReq(), child(0) producing no outputs for this query, which means that there is no column to sort on. So we solve this by having the source for Halloween insert produce at least one output column always.

@selvaganesang Please help to take a review again. Sorry for fix issues one by one, I am really not quite familiar with Java programming and this logic. Any new suggestions will be very appreciated, and thanks for your patient review again and again, this helps me greatly!
@robertamarton All your comments have been incorporated, could I merge this PR? üòÅ

yes

You are right, I did not see your earlier reply with the explanation. Please add this explanation to the code, because I think it helps to understand the fix. I looked at method NestedJoin::genWriteOpLeftChildSortReq(), and that code has an if statement marked "fix for soln 10-090826-4155". I assume that we get into this if statement and that we want to make sure that this if statement will produce an output.

It looks like your fix is only needed when the underlying table has a SYSKEY? You could add that check, but just adding the comment will help tremendously, since people can then find the place where the generated output is needed.
Once you add the explanation as a comment, I am +1 on this change.
+1. Please consider adding some sample output to the JIRA.
@sandhyasun Sorry for the late reply, I just saw your comment, thanks üòÅ
It looks like the change made via https://github.com/apache/trafodion/pull/594  to make the squirel to work is being undone.  Is that what you wanted?

+1
Looks good to me, but I have to admit I don't understand all the details.

Hi, Selva,
I think it is OK to merge it now. The retry logic is not the key. Let me wait for a few days, if you don't have objections, I will merge it. This is required by some users.
